newsitem.title: TAJIKISTAN: Fighting around Tajik aluminium town kills six.
newsitem.headline: Fighting around Tajik aluminium town kills six.

text.p: At least six people were killed on Friday in a gun battle around Tajikistan's aluminium producing town of Tursunzade, officials in the former Soviet republic said on Saturday.
"Two militia officers and four civilians were killed," Amirkul Azimov, secretary of Tajikistan's policy-making Security Council, told Reuters.
He said government forces had fended off an attack by warlord Kabir Abdullayev, who was trying to retake Tursunzade after losing control of the town last year.
A Tajik government officer connected to the fighting, who requested anonymity, said the death toll could be much higher, maybe up to 25 people.
A local official in the town reached by telephone said Tursunzade was quiet on Saturday.
In recent months, armed gangs have regularly attacked Tursunzade, 70 km (50 miles) west of Dushanbe, in bids by the country's myriad armed bands to control a large aluminium smelter there.
There was no word on whether production was affected although the smelter has usually continued to operate at about half of its 500,000-tonne per year capacity during similar clashes.
Tajikistan, which borders Afghanistan and China, is trying to emerge from a bloody four-year civil war.
